com.phunware.mapping

Class PwMappingModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.phunware.core.CoreModule
      • com.phunware.mapping.PwMappingModule

  • public final class PwMappingModule
extends com.phunware.core.CoreModule
    Get an instance of the PwMappingModule to install into the Core session.

    This module can be used to get data to set into a PwMapView, a PwRouteLayer.

    Building data. Get building data for the map with getBuildingDataByIdInBackground(android.content.Context, long, PwOnBuildingDataListener). Building data contains all of the meta data for a PwBuilding, it's PwFloors, and each LOD (level of detail) for the floors. LODs are referred to as PwFloorResources. A PwMapView uses this data to draw a map and otherwise to function.

    Point of Interest data. Get a list Points of Interest (POI) with getPOIDataInBackground(android.content.Context, long, PwOnPOIDataListener). Once this list is given to a PwMapView it can draw points on the map when relevant.

    Routes Get data for a route (if available) with getRoute(android.content.Context, long, long) or one of it's overloaded methods. There are also methods to help get route data in the background.
    There is a special method to help get a route from a point on the map; getRouteFromLocation(android.content.Context, float, float, long, long). This will find a route with the starting point near an X and Y coordinate. The actual starting point depends on the closest way-point that is set on the MaaS portal.

    See Also:
    PwCoreSession.installModules(com.phunware.core.CoreModule...)

      • getBuildingDataByIdInBackground

        public void getBuildingDataByIdInBackground(android.content.Context context,
                                   long buildingId,
                                   PwOnBuildingDataListener l)
        Get all building data for an ID in a background thread. The result is returned in the callback listener.
        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        buildingId - Building ID to get data for.
        l - Listener to receive result.

      • getRouteInBackground

        public void getRouteInBackground(android.content.Context context,
                        long startPointId,
                        long endPointId,
                        PwRouteCallback pwRouteCallback)
        Get a PwRoute between two PwPoints based on the point Ids. This doesn't look for handicabable routes.
        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        startPointId - Starting point ID.
        endPointId - Ending point ID.
        pwRouteCallback - Callback to receive data.

      • getRouteInBackground

        public void getRouteInBackground(android.content.Context context,
                        long startPointId,
                        long endPointId,
                        PwRouteCallback pwRouteCallback,
                        boolean isAccessible)
        Get a PwRoute between two PwPoints based on the point Ids.
        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        startPointId - Starting point ID.
        endPointId - Ending point ID.
        isAccessible - Flag to find a route that is handicapable accessible or not. If this is set to true then only accessible routes are returned.
        pwRouteCallback - Callback to receive data.

      • getRoute

        public java.util.ArrayList<PwRoute> getRoute(android.content.Context context,
                                    long startPointId,
                                    long endPointId)
                                      throws com.phunware.core.exceptions.PwException
        Get a PwRoute between two PwPoints based on the point Ids. This doesn't look for handicabable routes. This should be called in a background thread.
        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        startPointId - Starting point ID.
        endPointId - Ending point ID.
        Returns:
        Non-null PwRoute if there are no errors.
        Throws:
        com.phunware.core.exceptions.PwException - Thrown if there is an error getting the route data.
        See Also:
        getRouteInBackground(android.content.Context, long, long, PwRouteCallback, boolean)
